{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3127941,"name":"Yi Zhong","username":"CLCK","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/clck/{size}/186243_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-17T05:54:45.482Z","cooked":"

When I tried to import my 2022 code into a new 2023 project, it warned that the old Command-Based framework is no longer supported and asked me to rewrite it.
However, I didn’t know what should be changed as I’m rather new to it, and I also didn’t find any useful information on WPILib.

Moreover, when i tried to deploy the code to my roboRio, it said:

The startCompetition() method (or methods called by it) should have handled the exception above.
at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase.startRobot(RobotBase.java:433)
at frc.robot.Main.main(Main.java:23)
Warning at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase.runRobot(RobotBase.java:358): The robot program quit unexpectedly. This is usually due to a code error.
The above stacktrace can help determine where the error occurred.
See https://wpilib.org/stacktrace for more information.
Error at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase.runRobot(RobotBase.java:365): The startCompetition() method (or methods called by it) should have handled the exception above.
pure virtual method called
terminate called without an active exception

Many thanks to anyone answering the question.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-01-17T13:10:00.708Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":103,"reads":150,"readers_count":149,"score":560.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":423518,"topic_slug":"old-command-based-framework-not-supported-when-migerating-to-new-2023-project","display_username":"Yi Zhong","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56376,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer of Zodiac 6353"},"post_url":"/t/old-command-based-framework-not-supported-when-migerating-to-new-2023-project/423518/1","custom_user_title":"Programmer of Zodiac 6353","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3127945,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-17T06:07:51.987Z","cooked":"

This is a very good page to read through each year (New for 2023 — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation). You’ll find the relevant line right under the “Breaking Changes” header.

Given you’re new and therefore lack the background necessary to understand what half of that is referring to, prior to 2023, there were 2 “command-based” frameworks. Theyre very similar, but behaved quite differently behind the scenes and had quite a few differences in class/method structure.

As for how to fix your issue… you dont NEED to migrate the project. You can create a new one and manually copy over anything you may need. If you have a significant amount of code that gets reused each year, I’d recommend bundling that into its own library. Alternatively, you would need to go through your code and switch any old command-based stuff over to using the new command-based classes.

@Override
  public void autonomousPeriodic() {
    CommandScheduler.getInstance().schedule(RobotContainer.mDrive_auto);
  }

These lines in Robot.java caused the exception above, and I wonder if there’s a way to fix this issue in the newest 2023 framework as we did what you said (create a new project) to migrate it.

Sincere thanks if anyone can help.

I saw the rough solution on WPILib docs but I’m not that clear about its using. Can anyone help me and check if this is the proper solution so as to find out the right thing for me to learn about?

The Command Scheduler — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation (wpilib.org)

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-01-17T09:16:21.905Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":103,"readers_count":102,"score":30.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":423518,"topic_slug":"old-command-based-framework-not-supported-when-migerating-to-new-2023-project","display_username":"Yi Zhong","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/software/commandbased/command-scheduler.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"The Command Scheduler — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":5}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56376,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer of Zodiac 6353"},"post_url":"/t/old-command-based-framework-not-supported-when-migerating-to-new-2023-project/423518/4","custom_user_title":"Programmer of Zodiac 6353","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3127979,"name":null,"username":"Starlight220","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/starlight220/{size}/150872_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-17T10:12:31.674Z","cooked":"

The “old” command framework is from before 2020; I don’t think it’s relevant here – from the code you sent it looks like you’re already using the “new” (2020+) command framework.
Scroll up the log to find the actual stacktrace, which should lead you to the error. I recommend reading Reading Stacktraces — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation. My guess is that mDrive_auto is null.
When using statics it’s fairly difficult to ensure initialization order; I suggest reading the docs about recommended project structure and such.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-01-17T10:12:31.674Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":86,"readers_count":85,"score":47.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":423518,"topic_slug":"old-command-based-framework-not-supported-when-migerating-to-new-2023-project","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://wpilib.org/stacktrace","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Reading Stacktraces — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":2}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":45763,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6738a | ISR | WPILib"},"post_url":"/t/old-command-based-framework-not-supported-when-migerating-to-new-2023-project/423518/5","custom_user_title":"6738a | ISR | WPILib","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3128045,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-17T15:03:56.655Z","cooked":"

I believe that snippet youre referring to was AFTER migrating code to the new project as they said they did in reply to my suggestion. So it would make sense that it uses the structure of the new command-based framework.

@CLCK, are you able to share the rest of your code? Preferably as a link to github or a similar site. The info on how to read stacktraces is very useful, and would likely benefit you here. I agree with @Starlight220 that its likely null, but seeing the code would help identify WHY that may be.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-01-17T15:03:56.655Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":57,"readers_count":56,"score":16.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":423518,"topic_slug":"old-command-based-framework-not-supported-when-migerating-to-new-2023-project","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":45763,"username":"Starlight220","name":null,"avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/starlight220/{size}/150872_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"post_url":"/t/old-command-based-framework-not-supported-when-migerating-to-new-2023-project/423518/6","custom_user_title":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3128121,"name":null,"username":"Starlight220","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/starlight220/{size}/150872_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-17T16:21:18.514Z","cooked":"
Fletch1373:

I agree with @Starlight220 that its likely null, but seeing the code would help identify WHY that may be.

My guess is that it’s a static field that gets initialized by the constructor, but said constructor isn’t called. The recommended structure doesn’t have static fields, so this problem doesn’t happen.

Aside, there’s no reason to schedule commands in *periodic. Schedule the auto command at *init, and the scheduler will run it.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-01-17T16:21:18.514Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":41,"readers_count":40,"score":28.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":423518,"topic_slug":"old-command-based-framework-not-supported-when-migerating-to-new-2023-project","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":45763,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6738a | ISR | WPILib"},"post_url":"/t/old-command-based-framework-not-supported-when-migerating-to-new-2023-project/423518/7","custom_user_title":"6738a | ISR | WPILib","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3128126,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-17T16:26:43.717Z","cooked":"
Starlight220:

The recommended structure doesn’t have static fields, so this problem doesn’t happen.

This is, in fact, why the recommended structure doesn’t have static fields. Please avoid global state for things that aren’t actually global.
